story.text: A great deal of the issues and problems to do with learning revolves around the tension between structure and play time. Especially in an informal and self-directed setting the provision of a suitable framework for fitting the learning into the work day greatly helps outcomes.

In the case of working with the self employed or the unemployed (quickly becoming the same thing), the provision of advice or support for a daily routine can be particularly helpful. Here the provision of a clear structure is part of the learning outcome.

On the other hand, people who are already in highly structured, busy or working lives need a way in which to include their participation in simple to manage, flexible ways. As each [[pod club]] benefits from a curated mix of [[learning roles]], we seek a structure which can accommodate both formal and informal learning.
